column4: shutdown windows incorrectly, ntfs drive isn't mounting, what is the command ... fix ntfs ?
be aware that ntfs-fix doe not actually fix anything (in the sense of chkdsk) it just resets the 'clean' bits so you can moutn again rw, but that can be risky
i think the drive is physically overwritten, so nothing to rescue. you could try testdisk, tho
use it to search for lost partitions ?
yes. but as i see it you have physically overwrtitten the partition table and any partition headers with data, so i don't think there's much hope
the drive was mounted at the time
see what testdisk and possibly photorec can do for you, but if you have no backup you may be in trouble
dd is one of the linux power commands that can do very good and very dangerous things
the image i copied was 512 mb,  so obviously the parition table is gone. but what about the rest of the data, is there anyway of getting it
i thought that. there is nothing to recover. it's overwritten

photorec is doing a great job of restoring all the files, but unfortunately that isn't what i need. See i have backups, but i don't remember what i had on this drive. [small portable drive full of music/movies/pictures that I took to school] Is there a way to recover the file names, and not the conent ?
not that i know of something
allright, guess I will live without files and replace them when i go home for fall break.
best way to fix the disk and turn it into on nice fat32 ?
gparted will only crete a  499.98 MB fat32 partition when i ask for a 465.76 GB one
